subject: Self Care
title: The Power of Rituals
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Power of Rituals.

hook.text: A basketball player bounces the ball three times before every free throw. It's not superstition. It's focus.

buildup.text: Rituals are habits with intention. They carry psychological weight that simple routines often lack.

discovery.text: Studies show pre-performance rituals reduce anxiety by up to 40% and improve execution under pressure.

twist.text: The specific actions don't matter. The consistency of doing them signals readiness to the brain every time.

climax.text: Create personal rituals for transitions: before work, before meals, before sleep. They anchor your day.

punchline.text: Rituals turn ordinary moments into grounding ones.

quiz.question: How do pre-performance rituals help?
options: They reduce anxiety and signal readiness to the brain
